definition: extra/surplus/remaining/remainder after division/(following numerical value) or more/in excess of (some number)/residue (math.)/after/I/me
-ly/structural particle: used before a verb or adjective, linking it to preceding modifying adverbial adjunct
to leave some leeway/to allow for the unpredictable
to leave room to maneuver/to leave a margin for error
to have room to save a situation/margin for error (idiom)

sentences.english: Planning to use every minute of those 8 hours working is not leaving any margin.
sentences.chinese: 計劃充分利用8小時裏的每一分鐘就是不留任何餘地。

sentences.english: No such thing as a back-flow of ideas exists any more than there exists a return of a river on its course.
sentences.chinese: 思想並不比江河有更多倒退的餘地。

sentences.english: Be sure there’s spaces between things, so you’re not rushed.
sentences.chinese: 要確保每件事之間都留有餘地，這樣你就不會太匆忙。

sentences.english: The skip bombs were fused at fifteen seconds there was no room for error.
sentences.chinese: 跳彈的引信只有15秒，沒有任何出錯的餘地。

sentences.english: This gives me some starting and stopping leeway.
sentences.chinese: 這會給我一些開始和停頓的時間餘地。

sentences.english: Unfortunately, a small kitchen has limited options for improvement.
sentences.chinese: 遺憾的是，一個小廚房沒有多大的改進餘地。

sentences.english: And would you ask if the rent is still negotiable or not?
sentences.chinese: 還有，可不可以問問租金是否仍有商量餘地呢？

sentences.english: Though you need to make room for failure, you shouldn't just fail.
sentences.chinese: 雖然你需要給失敗留餘地，但你不應該只是失敗。

sentences.english: But economic problems at home can also make people feel they have few other choices.
sentences.chinese: 但海內的經濟問題也會使人們感到抉擇餘地未幾。

sentences.english: All of these are undebatable facts.
sentences.chinese: 這些全都是無辯論餘地的事實。

sentences.english: There is no any room for argument on that point.
sentences.chinese: 在爭論這問題上不留餘地。

sentences.english: We ourselves, of course, have no choice whatsoever in the matter.
sentences.chinese: 我們自己，當然沒有任何選擇的餘地。

sentences.english: The shop offers a large choice of hats and shoes.
sentences.chinese: 這家商店的鞋帽樣式繁多，可供選擇的餘地很大。

sentences.english: For those without relatives to take them in, there are few options.
sentences.chinese: 那些沒有親戚可以投奔的寡婦則很少有選擇的餘地。

sentences.english: In fact they have a slightly wider choice than the Lanton.
sentences.chinese: 事實上它們比蘭頓選擇餘地要大一點。

sentences.english: No, I'm afraid this is non-negotiable.
sentences.chinese: 不，我很抱歉，但這事沒有商量餘地。

definition: to concede/to give in/to yield/a concession/(linguistics) concessive
to contend on strong grounds/to argue strongly for what is right
suspense in a movie, play etc/concern for sb's welfare
in no way/not in the least/absolutely not
to strike back/to beat back/to counterattack
to consider/to weigh (a matter)/to balance (pros and cons)
